title: What led to Syria’s 13-year civil war, and why has fighting surged again?
author: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Kelsey Baker
excerpt: Breaking news, live coverage, investigations, analysis, video, photos and opinions from The Washington Post. Subscribe for the latest on U.S. and international news, politics, business, technology, climate change, health and wellness, sports, science, weather, lifestyle and more.

(AP)President Biden pardons his son Hunter, reversing his long-standing pledgeBiden had promised not to pardon his son, who was convicted of gun-related charges and had pleaded guilty in a tax case. “Raw politics has infected this process and it led to a miscarriage of justice,” the president said.By Matt Viser39 minutes agoThe New AdministrationKash Patel, a staunch defender of Donald Trump, is the president-elect’s pick to lead the FBI. (AFP/Getty Images)Lawmakers express doubt over Trump plan to replace FBI’s Christopher WrayFBI directors typically have 10-year tenures, unique among appointments in the executive branch. Democracy Dies in Darkness

President Biden pardons his son Hunter, reversing his long-standing pledge

Biden had promised not to pardon his son, who was convicted of gun-related charges and had pleaded guilty in a tax case. “Raw politics has infected this process and it led to a miscarriage of justice,” the president said.

By Matt Viser39 minutes ago

The New Administration

Lawmakers express doubt over Trump plan to replace FBI’s Christopher Wray

FBI directors typically have 10-year tenures, unique among appointments in the executive branch. Wray was appointed by Donald Trump in 2017.

With key government allies distracted by other conflicts, rebels regrouped

Syria’s civil war resembles a chess board of geopolitical interests, with Iran and Russia backing the government, and Turkey supporting some rebel groups.
